ySk9un0apSVRv9ex9bqDjA.text: We came in to Stack n Yolks in a Sunday morning around 10am. It is definitely not a kid/family friendly spot. The quality of food and service has majorly declined since they opened. They were out of all their juices even we came in. My pancakes were super burnt. The tables are unnecessarily close to each other. Im absolutely blown away that there's no changing tables in the restrooms. Rude. Just rude. The bathrooms were comparable to that of a truck stop. Filthy floors, out of TP, over flowing trash can. They also didn't offer my 3 year old a kids menu or crayons. Again, this definitely is not a place for kids. Won't be returning anytime soon. We'll stick to other breakfast spots.

EREFxRDPAozCbDNGfl49zA.text: Love this place! Always friendly and the food is so good good good! Comfort food all the way! Oh and the freshly squeezed orange juice is vitamin c heaven! Definitely try this place again for breakfast or lunch there pricing is not bad at all and you get a good meal!

JOfSPAWPKqo01eWCzpmDwg.text: Overpriced. Uninformed wait staff. No soup today because "It wasn't very good, we threw it out". Basic items (toast; uh, it's a breakfast spot) missing from order. Plates looked like they were purchased from a yard sale.

GtYWa3N4LYHHpjErSEr0wA.text: We have been here for over 40 minutes (got here at 9:20am). We have yet to receive our waters. I guess the kitchen was backed up. The table next to us just got their food. Waitress finally brought our waters after we received our food one hour later. She never apologized. We just packed our food to go and left. We used to come here a lot  but after so many bad experiences the last few months, we will not be returning.

2e82oZN5V9AT5Qn7ok0Kxw.text: Service was decent. Ordered the country fried steak. Kept thinking of Wendy's "Where's the Beef". Batter was thicker than the meat. Gravy was like glue and very bland. Probably won't be back. Too many other choices in this city.

I3s7cffErFBvR-Gscq9vNw.text: Best to keep it simple when ordering, and stick with the pancakes or omelettes. Sever was friendly even though she couldn't get the order right, or maybe it was the kitchen. Either way, keep it simple.

nQvKTXIGQrpGbc0CVEaYaA.text: The chorizo scramble was good and little pricey, wifey got the Belgian waffles and was over cooked, daughter order short stacks velvet pancakes and she love it, one thing for sure needs to improve, their coffee is horrible, 7-11 has better coffee, I'm from SoCalOc and I will try the one in Laguna Niguel soon.

5BZd4vev9BJLzwRbC9Tw0w.text: Have been a fan of this restaurant since it first opened!! Deliciously prepared food. Fair prices. The owner and staff are always nice and courteous.  The great food makes them pretty busy at peak hours, but there is always room for me and my guests. The portions are generous and the variety is large enough to suit everyone I've ever taken there. Whenever it is breakfast time near the southwest, it is Stacks and Yolks!!

9l3b5kbYKoAbPKXpDM1SsQ.text: We go every Father's Day. The food has always been good. It takes a bit to get your food which is good because they actually make it not heat it up. 3 years and counting.

MSFRHLB3CmHFuaiNRB2LEg.text: My buddy had the sirloin tips for breakfast which were cooked and seasoned PERFECTLY ......I had the birthday pancakes.  The food was on point and staff was so kind and amazing.  Going back for the pumpkin and mint pancakes soon :) Thx Guys!!

zD7zA7HG1-UbTzN5n6gCTQ.text: I had a great brunch with a party of six. The food was tremendous especially the jalapeno bacon. The pancakes were great especially the gluten free pancakes which is something that you rarely get to eat if you're allergic. Service was great especially from Brandon who helped to keep our plates coming on time. An excellent restaurant and I highly recommend it.

ISaD_NYzwM1Ys_-3LKxu0A.text: The absolute worst! Save your money and don't even bother with this place. I called to let them know that we were missing items from our order, also that chicken on  both orders was REALLY undercooked. "Bob" who answered the phone and was completely rude, this how they do customer service? After I'm trying to explain the situation to him he tells me "I did my part I don't know what else you want me to do" and hangs up the phone on me. Very disappointed in this restaurant, food was very subpar, cold, no seasoning, the pancakes had a burnt taste to them. Just disappointing.

eyxfVESTRdiQPiIpJNldVA.text: LOVE the pancakes. Everything else was very good, another standard breakfast spot. Friendly service. Cute decor. Relaxed ambiance. Family friendly. The whole place could use a hot, soapy scrub down. The table, chairs, condiments, and floor had a thin layer of stickiness I could have done without. But I'll definitely be back for those stacks!

YPl4Um9cypRgxkQeG-seaw.text: Solid breakfast spot in the Southwest part of Las Vegas. This place can get busy depending on the time of day but I see it being very busy that hour just after breakfast and just before lunch.    I had to try one of their skillets on this visit.  I was torn between the "Great Gobbler" and the "Philly".  Both ingredient combinations looked appetizing as did the others.  I decided on the "Philly" with thin steak grilled peppers and onions with provolone cheese melted over a king size bed of thick cut american fries and topped with 3 eggs over easy.  Wow! the portions are huge.  I couldn't believe they were topping these skillets with 3 eggs  while most places give 2. The iron skillet came out sizzling hot like the sound of fajitas at a Mexican joint.  Also the huge amount of potatoes underneath all the toppings will definitely be a challenge to finish.  I think they should cut the potatoes a little smaller to cook a little more evenly and crunchier but they were still awesome.  This was an excellent dish.  My friend chose the "Gobbler and he said it was delicious and filling as well.  Another in the group had the traditional eggs benedict and that was also demolished.    Overall visit was good, food was made with quality ingredients and the portions were very filling and prices reasonable.  I cannot wait to go back however this location is pretty far from my home and will have to be a destination location.  Stacks and Yolks does have a location closer to me in the north on Jones Blvd so I might have to do a comparison between the two.  This restaurants claim to fame is its pancakes claiming over 10 different batters.  So if you like to start your day with sweets you might fancy this concept.  I enjoy more of a savory dish to start my day which are also very good here.    Enjoy!

f37UYWvGLqi64XDeqXHiMw.text: I have been here few times. Under staffed and over priced . Potatoes were way over done and toast was forgot and it basically was untoasted.

DBYzWOO_98DdH-HThUtFFQ.text: This is probably the worst breakfast place ever. The food was served ice cold... to the point that our cheese wasn't even melted on the eggs- anyone like black burnt toast? No- me either! It might as well have been thrown at me. It was as if the waiter was having the worst day of his life. The owner had his entire tribe of screaming children running around the entire restaurant disrupting paying customers. We had two orders of the Mexican huevos- the steak was ice cold. We skillet came out piping hot, but wasn't made as it was listed on the menu. No feta cheese. My sour dough toast looked like toasted rye bread.   We made our complaints to the waiter and he went to speak with the manager, came back, three us the tab and said "I got you 20% off but that's all I can", as if we wanted something for free.. we just wanted our food to be offered to be heated at the very least and maybe fresh toast?   I'm not one to post reviews I was just literally THAT bothered by it. When I paid the tab the OWNER said- "sorry about that". Nothing further. DO NOT GO THERE AND WASTE YOUR MONEY.

x02Uy39hni-dvSYbyZz0FQ.text: Food was great service was ok, but what chaps my hide is there seating.  We're like sardines, and the waitress, are constantly passing by you and bumping you.  The person behind you is bumping you.  I will refuse these seats next time.  I will wait on a booth.  Com'on Stacks and yokes take care of your customers!  You will still get your coin!

eZriuWTGJo-0xw0T8zHgUg.text: Mad the "midsy" vibe as soon as I looked at the menu. Ordered the carne Asada burrito and it was ok at best. Meat was over cooked and I had fatty pieces that were rough to chew in every bite. Potatoes were kinda cold. Service was good though. Probably won't be coming back unfortunately.

AiLLhTIK7ZkOsnIB8LTDug.text: My first impressions of this place weren't great: I saw it on Las Vegas Dirty Dining and then noticed that it is located right near my residence.   However, it was a quick, empty breakfast spot to get a carnivorous breakfast dish for my husband while I grabbed JuiceBox next door. My husband really liked what he ordered, so we ended up coming back again with my Dad one day for brunch.  I tried their Garden Skillet, which is basically a veggie + cheese + egg (I ordered sans egg) skillet over potatoes. I wouldn't say it was "bad", but there's an unbeatable version of this skillet that I was accustomed to ordering at another restaurant back when I lived in the South Bay Area, California. This, compared to that, was like eating a mash of bland baby food. It was edible, but the flavor and care I was familiarized with just wasn't in this dish.  That said, they have a Unicorn pancake menu item here that I'm a little curious about. Not sure if I ever will try it, but due to the convenient location, I might.

7zsdQCO3DeRYzX-OvkM9Kg.text: This is the 2nd time here. The man server( not sure of his name cuz he never told us) seemed new cuz he was always rushing away from our table so he would never let me finish my sentence. He never informed us that they were out of strawberries for my granddaughters red velvet pancakes. He forgot to inform us that they were out of orange juice. I didn't want potatoes and He said I had to pay for a full side of fruit which was so small( not worth the price!!!). This place is over priced!! Not worth it at all!!! Not coming back!!

QLRT8FhkAiEz0ipjZY3jEg.text: I love the Always November pancakes. Pumpkin pancakes year around? Yes please. Not only do they look beautiful, they taste amazing. Fluffy squishy soft pancakes. Service is spotty at times but the food is consistently good. Weekends are super busy but during the week it a little better as far as getting seated faster.

q3LEHMg7hB0yNH04SdU_Bw.text: This place is overpriced & the service is terrible!  Came here with a friend on a busy weekend, we ordered the Monterey omelet add bell peppers and a waffle, well the waffle came out cold, so we sent it back & when they brought it out a second time it was drenched in powdered sugar. After they could not get our order right my friend was so annoyed he just got up and left. I too was annoyed & just paid the bill and wanted to get out of there. It wasn't until I got home that I noticed they way over charged us. They charged us a full hot chocolate when my friend asked for a little in his coffee. I ordered an OJ and both the hot chocolate and OJ were $4.99- such a rip off!! And the real kicker, they charged me $9.99 to add bellpeppers!!!! I've been trying to get in contact with them over the phone but they haven't gotten back to me to discuss this. Really unprofessional business.   GO TO EGG WORKS INSTEAD! That place is great

photos.caption: Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Overpriced rip off of a place: $9.99 for added bell pepper, $4.99 for OJ &amp; hot chocolate? Not going to this place again!!

YM7lJZJnM2J6z2tiG_4wFA.text: I decided to have a father/son breakfast this morning with my 9 year old. He ordered the chicken and waffles and I ordered the vegetable skillet with biscuits and gravy. It took a while for the food to get to us but they were busy and I wasn't in a rush. They waited until her food was done to tell us that they were out of chicken. He was disappointed but he's a kid so he may due with the waffle that he thoroughly enjoyed. I personally never received my biscuits and gravy and by the time I realized that they weren't coming I was just over it. The manager came over to apologize and said that he would make it right. I received the and was charged full price. I said something to the waitress and she came back with a 10% discount. In my view, we didn't receive 50% of our meal and to basically credit me the sales tax is unacceptable.  I won't be returning....ever. The only reason that I gave them 2 stars is because the food that we were served was pretty good.

i5-fJPlRBdzzv0awcda-0Q.text: We were seated quickly upon arrival. Immediately I liked the fun atmosphere of the restaurant and the staff were very friendly, but a little slow to bring syrup and refills. I also wasn't impressed with the food. I ordered the Meat Lovers Scramble and it was really bland. There was no flavor to the meats and the dish just lack seasoning. Same thing for the gravy. The rest of the dishes at our table ranged from ok to good.

khuImBNjEeQPyeXSRZ_75w.text: Let me start off the review with THE SERVICE HERE SUCKS. I was super excited to come here because of Instagram pics. And I was not impressed by the waitresses here. First of all I ordered the churro French toast with Nutella and strawberries with a piece of fried chicken. And my friend got the churro waffle with strawberries. We waited ONE HOUR for our food. And I saw people coming and going and getting their food before us. I asked the waitress to check on our food (she was the one with the long pony tail) she didn't even check back with me to tell me how long it would be. The other waitress with the red hair was a little better. After the hour and we got our food I still didn't even get the fried chicken I ordered. The French toast was a little too sweet for my liking. My friends waffle had burnt pieces inside and she was picking them out while she was eating it. And then I checked on the fried chicken and they said oh the cook thought it said chicken wings. This was already a hour and a half of being there. I completely finished my meal and then they bring out a grilled chicken piece which was not what I ordered! I was very upset and disappointed. I'll be telling all my friends not to eat here. Wish I could give it no stars. I'm not even blessing them with my food pics that I took.

phLvaKon7bS3aoOpYyIMaQ.text: We have been coming here for a while now it's close to the house.. the last 5 times have been horrible.. service is slow and all 5 time forgot the bread, messed up an order or brought the wrong order.. I want to be hopeful for this place.. if they don't get it together it will not survive.. Stacks and Yolks boo!!!!

aqOo4zCcJqEPz9L0sZB_9g.text: As soon as you walk in you get greeted, makes you feel welcomed. Keep doing it, big plus for that.  You choose where to be seated. Our drink order was taken right away and it came out right after. Same as our food. Chicken and waffles was delish, I enjoyed it a lot. Took half of it home because the portion was a pretty good size.   The staff was very friendly and attentive. Place looked cleaned, our utensils/plates/cups cleaned as well. First time coming here and I am pleased with the service they provided my friend and me.

aCfL3VS_9CxJR-2qVvrWQA.text: Wow!   Great little place!   Great food, good customer service and a pleasant atmosphere.     I was hungry for breakfast food for lunch and was pleasantly surprised with all the choices and good prices.   I had scrambled eggs with cheese on top and a burger patty. (Keto diet)   We'll be back later this week to try some more yummy stuff.

L2VrpUI7O_gY-bO2K__b7A.text: Stopped in for the first time.  First impression a warm, and cozy popular breakfast spot.  Nice menu. Well staffed however,  unorganized.  After everything was said and done,  I still have no idea who my server was. If they work as a team, or in sections,  I have no clue. While everyone was nice there were no steps of service.  No check back till the end, & no refills. The server that cleared my plate,  also cleared my 1/3 full water glass.  I may give it another chance at some point. I have been making it a point to hit different breakfast spots in the Southwest, I will say there is a lot of competition with better service.

S7G1oMWCaS1hAy-xWeWAnA.text: The main reason I wanted to write this review is to acknowledge the staff.  From the moment we walked in everyone was very helpful and in a good mood.  Throughout our time at the restaurant even if the waiters or bussers were waiting or cleaning other tables they checked to see if we were all right.  So good job guys.  Now on to the food...and before I start I do admit I went in with a biased opinion.  We went in mainly for pancakes and I had my mind set on how I think they should taste, so I admit this is my problem.  The pancakes were good but not what I was expecting. They also didn't have bananas for one of them but it wasn't a deal breaker.    In all good place for breakfast and great service

IWW5udKwVZAIZ7F13vvIWw.text: This was my first time coming to stacks & yolks. I was disappointed because we were seated and given water but after that we didn't have anyone help us for a while. The young lady that was suppose to help us just kept walking past us checking on everyone but seemed like she was avoiding us. I had to flag someone down to take our order. The young man that took over for us was very helpful and he accommodated is with everything we needed.   Besides the whole service incident, the food was very good ! We didn't have to wait a long time after we ordered, food came quickly. I don't eat meat so they allowed me to switch out meat for homefries w/ my combo. I recommend the French toast! So good !

ibM3j-uCbk2ziRuZxOTp0w.text: All the pancake flavors you can imagine, under one roof. Want pumpkin spice in July? They gotchu covered! I think it's called the November All Year, and it's huge and delicious. The chicken breast and waffles were also pretty tasty. The Hangover was a hot, yummy mess. The red velvet pancakes would've been good, if it wasn't drenched in that gross strawberry syrup. Maybe chocolate syrup would've made sense, or cream cheese frosting. But definitely no strawberry syrup.   Staff is nice. Parking was easy on a Monday morning. Place was fairly clean.   I'd come back to try the Smitty or Elvis next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. foooooood

ElSj5IYPbzymYlWgUUYIxw.text: I rather write this review than continue to eat the food I just ordered for take out. Spent $48 dollars on three combo meals and was not worth a penny.  Really wanted to try this place out because it's close to home.  Decided to do take out since my hubby and I had the little ones. It was a waste. Potatoes are super old and stale. The eggs came out burnt and the bacon just tasted horrible. The lemon blueberry I pancakes were just alright. Manager couldn't really offer much except for going back or taking care of us next time. I don't want to waste my time or money again on this place.

gExgcInnWD7k4J_IBwnHQg.text: We found another breakfast place off strip in Vegas!  So I follow this restaurant on instagram and it is why we came since our other go to was closed.  I was surprised to see the yelp average was less than I'd hoped .... but lucky for me it was not my experience.  They were very busy and it was actually nice that our server acknowledged that to us as we could kind of tell.  He was very nice however and took our order promptly.  I showed him my husband on a post on my social media with #stacksandyolks and is that how to get a free pancake? Yep! It's that simple. We let him decide which one to bring us.  I ordered an build your own omelette with cheese mushrooms and bacon. My husband got their churro waffle with a side of chicken.  My only complaint is that I asked for fresh fruit instead of hash browns but the fruit had not yet been cut up?! Ok ok ok force my carb loving butt to eat hash browns I'm not that mad about it.    We enjoyed the atmosphere we were in the back booth near the restrooms so it provided a little privacy but still got to see the action.  It is casual and small, clean and open.   Our food cans piping hot and my omelette was delicious - mine tasted like nothing less than fresh. The hash browns were plain but I liked them that way.  The churro waffle my honey is still talking about. But let ME talk about that chicken. Wow!! Juicy tender and perfect spice to it. We have never been able to find a comparable fried chicken to what we have in the south and this has been the best so far.  I would go back just for that chicken.  So good!   The free pancake he chose was actually probably not the free kind but we had been chatting with him and said we were from Reno and by golly I think he liked us!  It was pumpkin with whip cream and cinnamon and cream cheese frosting and was again, very good.  They had so many different flavors though that I would love to come back and try.  Very happy with our first experience here.

w2MemAQIvQ-mR_JqAd-uNQ.text: Went there on a Sunday at 1:50pm knowing they close at 3pm and was greeted at the door by an employee who told me they were closed. I mentioned that it says 3pm and he replied "the owner wants to close early today for whatever reason". I was a little annoyed I drove over here for this nonsense but then saw this and maybe it was a blessing "Stacks & Yolks has been labeled by the Health District as "Perpetually non-compliant." -ktnv.com

6H6o2m7bmzBfiurtw18kEA.text: I've been here once before and had a great experience. They have large portions of food and the pancakes are delicious, so they get 2 stars from me, but don't go here if you are in a rush and you want more than pancakes.   Today, I went in to celebrate my birthday with my family. It seemed like a typical Saturday morning, not too busy, people coming and going. 3 different women came to take our drink orders and it went just fine. We got our drinks and then we ordered our food. The kids all got the happy face pancakes. I got the chicken fried steak skillet with a smore's pancake. My fiancee got the corned beef hash with hash browns and a side of "bacon from heaven". It took about an hour to get our food and for the life of me, I have no clue what happened. Ha.   The kids food was fine. The only real complaint is that they got 2 grape eyes (normal), and orange mouth (normal), and a nose that was 2 large tablespoons of butter (not normal). They were a little disappointed that the happy face was not made of chocolate chips. I should have asked.   My skillet was okay. The potatoes didn't seem to have any seasoning, so I just put salt on mine. I ended up not eating the potatoes. The eggs and chicken fried steak was really good and I have zero complaints about that. It also came with a biscuit and gravy. The biscuit was warm but the gravy was ICE cold. It was almost like they took a fresh biscuit and covered it with gravy from the refrigerator. I didn't want anything to do with it. Which was fine. I had quite a bit of food and had planned to take stuff home.   My fiancee got home fries instead of the hash browns he ordered, which isn't a big deal, but what sucks is that he specifically ordered hash browns so that our 10 month infant could also eat some. Then, his "bacon from heaven" was CHARRED, you guys. Charred. Like, someone just left it sitting there. And then they served it to him like that. It was beyond disappointing. The pork belly was basically chewy and yucky.   After all of this, we didn't throw a fit or make a big deal. I just said what was wrong and got apologies from the staff, which is fine. But the manager refused to speak to my fiancee after everything was said and done. We spent about $80 and they gave us a $7 discount on our bill. The food being wrong and served badly is one thing, but for management to not even come speak to us and apologize is truly disrespectful - especially since the kids told the waitress we were celebrating a birthday. I'm not saying a birthday celebration deserves perfection, but if a meal is ruined on a celebration like that, maybe some accountability could be taken by management. I'm so disappointed and sad about this. I really hope that management learns to take ownership and really guide their employees to do improved quality checks before food leaves the kitchen and even making sure the kitchen is properly staffed for a Saturday morning/afternoon. The table behind me waited just as long for their food too. It was a huge clusterf*ck and diners deserve much better.

QMNiEFiz5tRUD9tCq2feIg.text: This is the best breakfast spot I have found since I moved to Vegas. Their pancakes are soooo good. One thing I don't like is the smell. I have been there a few times and it always smells damp, like mop or towels or something. Overall the food is good. Would be good if the coffee was better

tx9TVGciK-8t-ZRTFYuDRg.text: There are a lot of egg places in Las Vegas. Might all be owned by same company. All the same stuff. Good solid food.  Nice place for brunch and breakfast.

uBsrc4MTt7WXLWHtFRFkyQ.text: Wait staff was on it... I personally give them a 10 out of 5.... food was great however  my only complaint was my pancakes were cold when they came to the table. However very delicious! The western skillet was fresh and excellent.

uIF3fO58PvdAfMA7AR6Vbg.text: Excellent service thank you four youngsters they were efficient they were diligent and well-mannered good job guys !

RMtoU7bCT1vK8Tc-3anxPg.text: We ordered churros French toast and corned beef hash. The French toast was so good. The combination of sugar, cinnamon, and syrup made my morning. The corned beef and hash was okay, nothing special to it. Will be back to try the pancakes. I was eyeing the Alabama pancakes.

XbOul4q4cElZlvqvOSqHXQ.text: Was very excited to try this place. Unfortunately it fell short on several issues. Tried the blueberry and lemon pancakes and although GIGANTIC were tasteless and dense. My 2 scrambled eggs looked more like 1 small egg and burnt, hash browns were completely tasteless, but the sausage links were tasty. The service was excellent, even though they were jam packed we were seated pretty quick and "Brandon", was FANTASTIC. Will try the burger next time. They did remove my pancake from the check.

r3V3RxiKzsmvWurkrTUj8w.text: Omg where do I start! This place is a hot mess!   Joel and I were on this side of town for his job and we hadn't eaten breakfast. Since it was a Monday other places in the area were closed. So Stacks & Yolks it was.   Right away when you walk in there is confusion. It's not a lack of staff either. There are plenty of people just total unorganization. When we were finally seated. (There was a hostess stand outside, but no hostess.) We weren't even given menus. We had to sit there for a while until we finally could flag someone down. They took our drink orders and came back to take our order. I had decided on the Crab Cake Benedict and Joel had the regular Corn Beef Hash with a side of sourdough toast. While waiting for our food I had to practically beg for a refill on my coffee and a water. Also, while we were waiting our waiter came over and asked if we had ordered something that we had not. Then he went around to all the other tables asking who's order it was. Wow. That was not a good sign. Our food came out and I was ready to dig in. The waiter not the original waiter asked what kind of toast Joel had wanted and he repeated Sourdough. The waiter said it would be right out. My Crab Cake Benedict looked kinda sad. The Crab Cake itself was crisp and tasty, but the Hollandaise sauce was clearly old cause it wasn't runny, but congealed. The potatoes had no flavor and tasted like something they threw on the flat top for 1 minute and pulled off. Well, after 10 minutes Joel finally got his toast. It wasn't Sourdough however, but Wheat. It was so dry and cold that the fake butter wasn't even melting. It was some seriously sad toast. Talk about sad was Joel's Corn Beef Hash. We were both assuming it would be freshly made in house. We were very wrong. It came out of a can and was gross. I really felt we could have made it better at home. He asked for his eggs to be poached. Which they were, but  they were served in a little bowl that still had some water in it. Why not put them dried on the hash itself?    So we are done with our meal and I ask for the check. The waiter said he'd bring it over. 15 more minutes roll by and no check. Meanwhile, people were standing outside glaring at us because they are waiting to sit down and eat! The waiter comes back and asks "have we gotten our check?" I respond with a "no." He walked away. I was hoping to get the check!! By this time my debit card is out and I'm annoyed. Finally, some other guy brings us our check. I didn't even look at it. I just handed him my card and the response I got was a fist bump. Normally I'm down for fist bumps, but a fist bump is not an acceptable form of apology for bad service and bad food. Just sayin!   I will never again return here. It was a total waste of my money and my time. Believe me heed my warnings and steer clear!! Run, run now!!!

n4tWUx4yfWccdYU-wnYJ8Q.text: Very solid service, but out of the 3 times I've been in for breakfast, my order was incorrect twice, my wife's once. The pancakes are creative and the menu has plenty of tasty options, but when you're not sure what's going to be served, you sort of lose faith in the establishment. That, and maybe it was just bad timing, but I've seen cleaner bathrooms at truck-stop gas stations.  I really tried to like this place because the guys working there seem to genuinely want to provide a great dining experience.

2MLN79RL8zsPTuRdU7M_8g.text: I usually have a good experience in this place, but today was disappointing, toast was hard as a rock, it tasted old and looks like it was a reject from another table, my coffee was warm and refills was nonexistent, the section I was setting smells like urine, so maybe it's just one of those days, consistency is the key so guest will continue to come back...

oJDDbbOd-sUcKKOlAxbImQ.text: WORST PLACE EVER!! everybody's sucks !! Just went there for the first and last  time ever. Bad customer service. Dirty dinning. zAjGuL9StOGc_JQi0G-7SA.text: I ordered the garden skillet and the bell pepper was raw, it had minimal cheese, it had no flavor, no seasoning. It looked like they split my husbands corn beef hash into 2 very small orders in order to cover their mistake. We will not be back.

ZUbzxCDNBcoDfytsWeaEbA.text: Great spot for a decent real breakfast.  Next door to my good friend at Quickdraw tattoo

tbwdzZtkpIH4L-MGd_kEJg.text: How many wait staff does it take to change a light bulb? I hope not as many as it takes to get a simple coffee and drink order in. 4 diff. Wait staff ask us what we would like to drink over the course of 20 minutes yielding no drinks. Makes no sense. By the time we finally got our hard earned water and coffee we were ready to order. Who actually knows who our food server really was? The food was pretty tasty albeit taking a while to get to us, however by the time we got it I was so hungry that I forgot I ordered a side of bacon that wasn't delivered, until I looked at the check and brought it to their attention. When I went up to the counter, the bacon was coming out, lol. To their credit they took it off the bill, but there's just too many awesome breakfast places in Las Vegas that are more affordable with much better service. Very Disappointed.

F1Fjdh5RSV0kPTc_qWxi4w.text: This place was amazing, and the staff was just delightful.  The food was great, and it came out so efficiently.  Friendly servers and good food?  That's an A in my book.  I will be seeing these people very soon!

CX3esmpFrDrSFkGR7fwIiA.text: The red velvet pancakes were tasty, but the consistency was a little rubbery. I have never been before, but my brother who is a local says they are usually better. They were OK, but I was expecting more given all the mentions in the reviews below.  We sat outside which was nice and our server was new but did very well. I wouldn't have imagined she was on her second day unless she told us.

c9mPH0NZewn-MJyneSpgRA.text: Checking this place out for the first time. Friendly atmosphere and friendly waiter. Eggs undercooked and the home fries are bland and under seasoned. Otherwise an ok place for breakfast.

CL805mlOCZJy0hnzSibQZA.text: Amazing. Best breakfast food I've ever had anywhere. And super cute location. Kinda lame they make you wait outside for a table but I understand it's small in there and it's worth the wait for sure!! Orange juice is amazing and the pancakes are bigger than your head so don't order 3 like I did the first time . One is sufficient. Love this place!!

4Qz4f0M9Znm-1KOCvHDUjw.text: So I've been hearing commercials and seen good reviews for this place that's in our neighborhood, and wanted to give it a try. I got some friends to go with us. There was a little bit of a wait but not too bad, it was a Sunday morning after all. Staff we encountered were nice and friendly. I ordered the Mexican Huevos (9.99) Tortilla topped with chopped Steak, Onion, Green Pepper & Cheese with 3 Eggs. I can't recall what anyone else ordered but my husband got a Single Stack Coconut Pancake (3.99) to try. The Coconut Pancake was huge, I liked it, I would go back for another pancake. But my Huevos weren't all that. The portion was huge! Gigantic soft tortilla with all the stuff on top of it. It was okay just nothing special, the steak lacked seasoning. I would think if it's called Mexican it would have some spice or heat but unfortunately it didn't. It was all rather bland. Everyone else at the table seemed to feel the same about their meals. Bummer. I'd give it another try but with all the breakfast joints around it may take awhile.

YeDOff2BkV-4-NFvIwRUcQ.text: Food excellent service eh could be improved that's why only 4 stars. For the gobbler very good, turkey sausage, Spinach, potatoes and 3 eggs. Staff seems new, very disorganized, told us to sit anywhere then thought we were already there o would recommend siting each table to know more what's going on, for our part we had 3 different servers help us and had no idea what was going on. Each server should probably have a section and stick to it.  Will be back and hopefully a better experience

U9cA9bmO4rGlJacvpKLMnw.text: LOVE this place.  Amazing food and the guys there could not be more nice.  Sometimes service is pretty slow but generally understandable when you go in on a Saturday or Sunday morning and the place is packed.  I've taken a handful of people there and they all have said the place is great and have all become Griddle breakfast fans.

7RYV_K3qRdr4gybLLtqeVQ.text: This placed is cramped with people in such a tiny space. The hostess told us it would be 15-20 minutes wait but we finally got seated after 25 minutes. Service was horrible and the food was not as described in the menu. I ordered a short stack of meat lovers pancakes and got a single which turned out to be a blessing since it did not taste good. The menu portions were not as expected having tried Egg Works and Pappas. I would not recommend to friends!

HvmoO98gawJi_lLzBJU7Fg.text: Had breakfast here ordered Kit's hash, eggs bene, and tried the apple cinnamon roll pancakes. Food was ONO!! I would defiantly come back.

5kFk8iuwd9-6jhw5NjpUHQ.text: This place SUCKS! I'm more than willing to pay high prices for a good meal, but man this place robs you. Plus the food is very bland, and for what you pay you leave hungry. Also the service sucks with a smile.

5P8iWsmaReHBJskVNTP5wQ.text: When visiting family,love to go out for a good breakfast or lunch.  Grand kids were fussy and daughter,Clair and I pulled in to the nearest spot. The Family Food Gods were looking out for us!!!  Great chicken salad(I'll have what she is eating). Kids had KIDS MENU items(they ate it all) and Clair had a salad too.  Food was great ,price was great,BUT the service was the BEST.  We were welcomed when we came in,even thought it was busy.  we were given our drinks right away and then greeted by the owner to take our order. He(sorry I forgot his name) was so endearing to my family and made the dinning very enjoyable. We went back the next morning for their Fabulous pancakes.  The orange cranberry being my favorite,Clair's the buckwheat( I ate those while pregnant with her) and the kids ate the chocolate whip cream happy face pancakes. I even ordered Pancakes to go!!!!   WE WILL BE BACK.

0irdviS7d8KszCMXDb6c-Q.text: Great food great value! The apple cinnamon pancakes were delicious! The atmosphere was fun. Very personable staff.

LTWQHjTl31V7Whf75SgDJA.text: Not sure about this spot yet. Walked in to women restroom bathroom,  they just opened and its pretty gross,  it kind of already grossed me out.  Even to order food.  Sorry but that says a lot about a place. Take pride in you spot.

T9h9HS7tjZNEcsD-WBcexg.text: Wow is all I have to say about that experience. I met the owner right when I first walked in, he was so welcoming and gracious. They had the most polite and attentive staff that I've ever seen. The food was out of this world. The owner sat down with us, because it was our first time and wanted helped go over the menu, in order to better serve us. What a great start to the day I Very strongly recommend Stacks and Yolks to anyone looking for an amazing breakfast experience.

t05WrE46lAcOFPdC-3RZxg.text: Love this place! Only one suggestion-please offer REAL maple syrup. The pancakes are soooo good. Maple syrup would make them perfect!

Bo_PhpMWYQuvoW8f_dQkKQ.text: Wish i lived closer so i could go back. Great customer service, amazing food, and fast service. Not to mention their huge selection of pancakes and waffles! 1 pancake is bigger than my head and only 2.95$ Great breakfast and lunch selections for a great price!

8dElIsCjbiyXcBhOR2AiVA.text: Immediately inviting decor and staff. Very artistic and cozy! Freddy was a rad server! The fact that they have vegetarian/vegan options a huge plus. The food is freakin delicious and I can't wait to bring everyone back!!! See you's soon. 1ove

photos.caption: Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My awesome friend Meagan strikin a pose at our new favorite breakie spot!

UBLgSihWNvWy-60jM5XlEQ.text: Service was excellent and friendly.  Prices reasonable and food very good.  I had Pancakes with eggs and bacon and it was a lot of food for the price.  Will definitely return.

HFeQHxk5ZWv0-5ZWiarWCA.text: The food was amazing, such flavor. I never finish all my food ,and I found myself searching for the crumbs it was that yummy. The service well that's clearly an area of opportunity for them. Next time I'd opp for takeout :)

JJ_CemZhsgRvL7Hyrxd-dA.text: Check this out, they landed on Dirty Dining! Copy & Paste in browser and watch the truth. ktnv.com/news/local/1621... youtu.be/wtMWfvwBJng I decided to try this place again was because they had an "A" Grade now. My remarks: Walked in and was greeted by owner, we chose a table and the place was not busy a total of 5 people. Owner came over after waiting several minutes and we placed our order, the order felt rushed as he was looking around constantly. Order arrived fairly quick but it was cold and not as ordered. Fast does not mean good! The waiter (owner) did not check back to see if we needed anything. The guy who got us the drinks came back and I told him my eggs were undercooked, not as ordered. He took them right away and said o.k. I waited for 15 minutes no eggs returned. The guy then returned after 20 minutes and I said did you forget about the eggs and he said no and by then my boyfriend was almost completely done with his plate of food. He runs back gets the eggs and they arrive less cooked than last time, eggs were running all over the plate. I took the plate up to the owner who happens to be our waiter and told him to take them off the check. He apologized when we were leaving, but the food was not worth the price!

k8uV5LvK-hpy2mwHRKgMyw.text: Service is always awesome and the breakfast is amazing. Come here at least 3 times a week just for the bacon and eggs, and it's great every time.

cIfo-3-lHaC4EbHv23sl1A.text: I love this place and thats why im giving it two stars ,but don't come in on Sunday mornings , it's been 45 since I placed my order and my eggs have not arrived , this review is only about the sloooow service on Sundays and not about the food taste or quality, this is a breakfast joint , you would think they'll be prepared for a Sunday morning since they didn't change their menu or anything, damn it I'm hungry and still waiting.........     10 more min just passed , not a single person as come to my table to let me know whats going on with my food,  I'm leaving

CDql_nceNNssHTWXd1X2KQ.text: The food was great put the service was a little slow. Had to wait about 15 minutes for someone to take our order then we had to wait for the server to come back so we could get refills

OshNu-_nL5LdkfYQOATtVA.text: Meh, indeed.  I'm fine with greasy food after a night out, but this was disgusto greasy. Like, mop my plate and blot my eggs and bacon greasy. The Red Velvet pancakes were fine for the first couple bites, but dried out as you got to the middle. Seating is too close for comfort, and the blasting club music really didn't fit the ma and pa feel this place was probably going for. The most disturbing part was the faint sulfur smell that came and went during breakfast. They must have had some sewage problems or something. Blech. I gave it two stars because the service was very prompt, genuinely friendly, and it's not the waiter's fault that the food was ill-prepared.

SltfkzgPxfYYYySxT_XVkw.text: Good food and friendly service! Delicious pancakes. Will definitely go back when I'm craving pancakes. I liked their pancakes better than baby stacks, and the whipped butter(margarine) they use is to die for!

b6-th2EtU17Vu1rLZRqxVA.text: Always so happy eating here!  Pancakes are phenomenal! Super friendly service which I love!  Thank you Baja you're awesome!

VRbKOPI1sP9oAvcmXg-bLg.text: The atmosphere and people itself deserve 5 starts.. What a great bunch of friendly happy people.. And in Vegas that's RARE these days... I'd make my way back a couple times a week but it's a little too pricey for that but perfect for a random breakfast morning... The French toast was on point.. The orange juice was way too thick for my liking- I felt like I was eating an orange... From a cup. The ordering and paying process is a bit confusing, you're not sure if you sit down and wait or go up to the counter.. We woulda sat there for an hour ready to go if we didn't see other people walking up to the register... But all in all it was good and I'll be going back =)

m5osDq_rIK7lx31RmwAuVw.text: I don't know where the dissatisfied diners ate, but I found Stacks n Yolks to be perfectly delightful.  The service was fast and friendly.  The food was well prepared and tasty and we got multiple refills on our coffee. The facility was clean and I really liked the multicolored wood wall.   I often have a problem with restaurant prepared breakfast potatoes being too greasy for me.  The potatoes that came with my Eggs Benedict were just right and the poached eggs were properly done. My daughter's breakfast skillet was also very nice.  It must have been good since she wasn't able to finish the whole thing and took the leftovers home with her.   I'll definitely be back!

cV5uLlsCg-MfCGHBSMf3wA.text: The lemon blueberry pancakes were pretty good. The food in general was good. The place gets packed every weekend, there was a wait when we got there. But we had to pack our food up right when it came to the table and leave. There were quite a few flies around the front area. Very bothersome, kept getting at our food. None of the staff said anything about it or even tried to acknowledge the fact that they were there.  I would have given more stars but it was very irritating to try to keep them away from our food.

sqD2TgS9ybfowhkO-XsHvQ.text: Yeah, it was good, but for the price I find it expensive, they would have earned an extra star if their prices were a few dollers cheaper, and yes just like the previous yelper mentioned he thought one of the waitress's was absoultly stunning, and belive me she is! You can't miss her!,,Would i go back? Maybe but not for awhile as there are too many other breakfast joints here in Vegas that are just as good but cheaper.

PflaVuP4rNZhi5VvvX4oSg.text: Decent service - bland food.  It's like this place lost its mojo.  No fault to you, Freddie.. your service was great.  Eggs Benedict was okay, nothing to write home about.   The Hollandaise sauce needs a little something... like, flavor or whatever.  My boyfriend had the Meat Lovers Scramble and basically licked the plate clean.   It's breakfast, so I'm not going to sit here and nitpick the place to death.. it is what it is.  Convenience would be the only reason I ever go back to this place.

Ybvgy_iaIUVDC3-FTvcIXw.text: Pancakes WERE dry that last review wasn't crazy. maybe its just a certain cook i dunno. but when we went, there was only 1 other table being served our meal still took around 30  minutes to get our food. he messed up our order but was quick and pleasant to fix the error. pancakes are HUGE. so if you like pleasant atmosphere, dry pancakes, and don't have anywhere to be soon, this is the place to be.

9yb7uzJryBfoz2iVDWbMCg.text: This used to called Griddles...hopefully stacks and yolks can stay.great food and friendly service. I had the garden skillet which was to much for me to eat in one sitting. Can't wait to visit again

bPW3rRV0Ff0hrUoqGZfMrQ.text: Solid food, much like your normal "diner" type place without typical "diner" decor. Staff is extremely attentive and friendly, and the food is really good for the price. I'd definitely come here again.

XF43pbu18XMEhenFWN51NQ.text: The cook doesn't know how to make poached eggs, over medium, or anything but scrambled.

02JcWjXxe1rYWG91XSdUNw.text: Ive been here several times now and each experience has been great! Good food, and friendly atmospere.  Waits can be a little long on weekends, but the usually put out a little coffee set up when lones are long. Would definitely reccomend!

JyUTTRZ4tnKRZ_EVJ51pig.text: This joint looked like it was good but unless you wanna wait 45 minutes to get a seat and 30 more for your food by all means this is your kinda place it's smelled like burn grease in there when I left I smelled like I've been working over a hot stove for 12 hours straight but that's just my opinion

NiC5srbfVqJT-h22pDQ3aA.text: Just don't bother.   The restaurant seems harmless, but it is not worth having to endure mediocre food and absentee service. I noticed some of the other comments about lack of cleanliness and it is still noticeable today. The chairs and booster seats for kids looked filthy. Silverware is dull and dingy. Sometimes it's OK to spring for a new bottle of ketchup when the original labeling is nearly worn off and the cap is battered. It makes one wonder what other corners are being cut...  The food is OK, just unremarkable and unmemorable.

-PYQR5YiR855hmWT_UNZIg.text: First time trying this place and def better than I expected! The menu has a great variety of things. My daughter got the peanut butter pancakes topped w/ peanut butter and loved them. I got the homemade corn beef hash and poached eggs. The hash was fantastic! I'm always nervous to try it at new places because it's my fav and not that many people do it right ITS WONDERFUL def recommend trying it. My poached eggs were perfect. Service was fast and friendly and prices were just right. We will be back!

28D0YuJ4t4EfOSulwtjbvw.text: I got the red velvet pancakes. They were SO good and the cream cheese icing on top was money! My friend got the ham and cheese omelet which was really good too. Their orange juice is aaaaamazingg!!! I always look for fresh squeezed oj and honestly this place has it!!! Amazing I tell you. The staff was super friendly we had multiple servers check on us which means they work as a team which is great. I'd definitely come again! Ps. Try and get the food truck into Unlv's campus! I'd go there im between classes for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes! Yuum love the cream cheese icing stuff. So good!!

wTWFWR5k_G1EWw3cyQjZ2Q.text: No matter the time of day or the day of week this place is always hopping with people!  Expect a small wait but you will be rewarded with good service and excellent food.

1TQCFZfdAqpSdfW2073uhQ.text: Came here over egg works because we like the decor and food better, knowing it would be more difficult to get a table at 12pm on a Sunday. Quoted 15 minutes for a table, took closer to 30. Little chilly waiting outside. They should offer coffee to waiting guests. Finally sat, waited 5 minutes to be greeted. Gave our entire order when she arrived. We come here for their different Benedicts. The best part is the runny yolk mixing with the hollandaise. Both of our plates pretty much had hard boiled eggs. Potatoes were cold. The place is busy. 20-25 tables or so. Maybe 2 servers? Staff up!

ENUAtPB2ezaTZeiZJfXrYQ.text: The food is good but the service is awful.  Very unorganized. If you are in a rush its not the place to to go, not enough staff for the amount of customers

vs4I3SuynFoapzLrPeryhQ.text: Yet another breakfast joint to add to my long list of favorites! Just like their sister store in the east, The Griddle in the southwest does a great job of serving up the first meal of the day.   First off the service is great. Friendly people with a sense of humor. The place is tiny but great decor and there is also outdoor seating. I usually stick to the basic egg, canadian bacon duo but I did a combo on my last visit due to a severe pancake craving. All good! The choices of pancake flavors are plentiful! The coffee is also pretty great quality for a place that churns it out nonstop, not watery or lukewarm. The people next to us got a skillet and MAN it smelled amazing. Lunch lovers they take care of you as well with assorted wraps and sandwiches.   The pricing is just fine and just off the highway, can't beat the location. They do a steady business but I've never had to wait at this location. Watch for the sign though, you could miss it from the road!

5ep92cUp8B3kpA5APGm8zQ.text: This is our go to spot every time we leave Vegas. That might have to change. Today was horrible. First off we were told a 20 min wait and it was more like 40. The menus were filthy as were the metal tables we were sat at outside. We had to as for place settings, salt, pepper, creamer, hot sauce and never got our water. We had 3 different servers ask us if we had had our order taken yet. Organized much? My red velvet pancakes had to be sent back because we got out food literally like 5 mins after we ordered which great they're fast but my pancakes weren't cooked all the way through. During our rushed 20 min meal we were asked about 15 times if we needed anything else. Yes,,, let me eat!!!! And water. Which we never got from any of the 6 people who asked. I understand it's Sunday and having worked at a busy restaurant I understand to a degree. The nasty ass menus at 9AM NO! They should all be wiped down the night before. The disorganization was insane. Aside from my under cooked pancakes the food was fine. I'm sure we can find some place else to enjoy our pre drive home breakfast.

TBNdMTPoimDMEzvjQ8GPew.text: Been wanting to try this place for a while.  Now I can cross it off my list forever. Had the pumpkin pancake combo and the pancake tasted sour. Not appetizing at all. Place was busy so I guess that's why the coffee refills were slow in coming. Not a fan.

PUn-1NJ7uSgQXUcymiknhQ.text: I'm actually still sitting here waiting for my food as I write this.... well over an hour to get breakfast. And it isn't even busy. Waiter left the food on the counter so long it go cold and they had to recook.  Will definitely never come back here again. Suggest anyone that wants a good breakfast in a reasonable amount of time go elsewhere.

-QHVBe7-V9qiS3ugBd2j3A.text: Can I give 10 stars?  This is the best breakfast ever and I've traveled all over the country.  I've been here several times and it's been great every time.

xhD88aDQrxi7S7AfFZwLLg.text: The First and it will be my last time here. It wasn't busy and we waited 30mins for 1 pancake,2 eggs,and 2bacon. And it wasn't hot. It was the WORST red velvet pancake I ever had. It was big,hard, and touch to swallow. The environment had a weird vibe and The only thing that was quick was Sam picking up the her tip. The reason for the 1 Star is when we told the busboy about how Disappointed we were in the pancakes he laughed and said I know,  I heard they taste like rubber now.   It was funny in the moment but then I started thinking about paying full price for something that they are very aware of that's not good. So I'm saying NO to the Stacks and YES to the Yolks

dvONIeV651GLtQoH_75KAA.text: Came here for breakfast with a friend. They are located on Durango just off the 215 same plaza as Wells Fargo. Now they are usually bust here because it's a popular place to eat. Now as for the menu they have a variety of choices from pancakes, omelets, and wraps. The food is really good I can't argue with that but the service wasn't all that great. I  had asked for  water  and I never recieved it they forgot my side order and a few other things.

v_qpjYlMOZBtADfBWNLp-g.text: I've dined here quite a few times with friends so this review is long overdue. Usually when I come it's packed and there's a short wait. I came yesterday later in the day around 1 and there was hardly anyone in there. So if you're coming early in the morning be prepared to wait for at least 15/20 minutes. They have an awesome breakfast and lunch menu with really good options. I try something new every time. My first time here we had the chicken and waffles which were disappointing, the chicken was flavorless and the waffle was meh. My friend had the red velvet pancakes which were delicious though. I've had 3 of there egg Benedict's which I loved! The traditional was my favorite. The crab one was lacking something. The California Benedict was good not amazing though. I definitely recommend there skillets! We had a steak one with 3 sunny side eggs on top and man was that tasty! All of the skillets come with home fries (chopped potatoes) on the bottom. You have the option of egg whites or eggs prepared to whatever your liking is on top of the skillets. The service is always quick and friendly, I've never had a bad waiter or bad experience dining here. The only thing this place is missing is bottomless bloody Mary's and mimosas lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican huevos
Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California eggs Benedict
Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Today&#39;s special steak skillet

ER-eVaBwKLw_sC7ySH2kfw.text: I have been to Stacks & Yolks several times now, but am not in love with the food or service. We started eating here because my husband is a fan of their Bacon from Heaven. Unfortunately, the last 4 times we have been here, it wasn't available and they did not even bother to tell us until 10 minutes after we placed our order. I mean seriously, if you are not going to serve it, take it off the menu or at least let the employees know so that they can tell customers right away!  The best dish I had from here was the Chicken Breast and Waffle. Unlike other breakfast restaurants, the waffle here is pretty thick, and the chicken was juicy and tasty. Here are the others that I have tried:  -Always November (single stack): This pancake had a good pumpkin flavor, but the cream cheese was too thick for my liking. The single stack was huge - I was only able to eat half of it. -Smitty (single stack): This pancake was just way too dry, but the mint flavor was not overwhelming.  -Biscuit and Gravy: The biscuits were not warm and the gravy was tasteless and horrible!  Service is a hit or miss. Usually, its not good at all - most of the servers do not care to check up on you or refill drinks. However, there are 2 servers that I remember who was very friendly and attentive. This restaurant is also very small and crowded. The tables by the kitchen counter are the worst because of the traffic and you feel uncomfortable eating when so many people are walking by and bumping into you.   Not recommended. There are other breakfast restaurants that are so much better in this city, so do not waste your time!

LT_NhNhKotYO-mnxx02Vnw.text: Great breakfast experience on Easter morning. Brandon and Angel did a wonderful job! Would come back anytime and recommend to friends! M Yow, meyowjr@gmail.com

62xCfzrCioFltVQxvoM8IQ.text: Awful. Will never come back here again. The food wasn't bad but the service was TERRIBLE. The girls were more concerned on gossiping than worrying about customers. We had to ask our waiter for everything - need more coffee please, need a spoon please, need a napkin please. The manager just sat at the table and didn't bother helping at all. They were sitting people throughout the restaurants and helping only the bigger parties, probably hoping to get a bigger tip. Terrible terrible terrible. Not to mentioned I just noticed this place was JUST on dirty dining (just my luck). I can see why! This place needs to be shit down. Nothing like the sister restaurant to this place in southern Vegas!

QxDD3IevUShmJMAtt1Cq1w.text: Not good,  Potatoes burnt the 1st time 2nd time under cooked. Bacon I like crispy but they brought me over cooked crumbly char the 1st time. 2nd time oil temp was wrong an bacon was crispy yet under cooked. Buttermilk stacks needs some flavor attention! On the up side   Got the eggs rightthe Waitresses were nice, place has a cool look.  Chef needs to up his game!!!

MToXyfHa8s4zWgWftEXbYQ.text: The food is very good. They give you a big portion so come hungry.  Our server, Brandon was hilarious and super friendly.

0-l99nHgg9md8BAdO280Lw.text: I had an awful experience here.  First of all, my coffee came out cold and we had to ask for creamer and utensils.  Secondly, the menu was confusing and seemed unorganized.  Lastly, once we got our food my boyfriend found a hair in his order.  Once we told staff, they took off his meal but charged us for everything even though we were too disgusted to touch anything else.  I live across the street so was hopeful of a good breakfast place.  This place does not have my recommendation.

nKXXJ-0Na7bm2tv9_5iQsg.text: It was okay.  My husband ordered the crab cake Benedict and it was alright. The crab cake was decent, but the egg was over poached. When you think Benedict you think a nice poached egg where the yolks runs out. It was cooked .   I ordered the oatmeal with Granola berry topping. Again it was okay. It wasn't amazing or anything extraordinary, something you can make at home.   Service was fine. The staff is friendly. two things for me the irked me was that my husbands entree came way before mine. Probably waited a good 5 minutes by the time he got his to when I got mine. If I had ordered something complex I would understand the wait, but I literally just got oatmeal, topped with granola and chopped berries.    Also both bathroom doors are broken! That was probably the most annoying. I mean common fix your bathroom doors! At least one of them.

photos.caption: Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oatmeal berry
Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Benedict

1kMjMwpdnSR9fOJz8WD17Q.text: I may as well have ordered a stack of pancakes on my head and a couple yolks to the face for brunch. They were a disaster today. We arrived around noon well after the Saturday breakfast rush and didn't experience a wait to be seated, which was one of the only pleasant parts of this visit.  There are hiccups in service & then there are flat out belches. We got a bit of both here. From getting a cute plate of sausage patties delivered instead of the patty melt I ordered, to my friend's waffle coming out 20 minutes after his eggs & potatoes did, this was becoming wayyy too much and too little in record time! I also got fries instead of the breakfast potatoes I ordered, which was also a fun bonus.   While it did take forever for all of our correct food to appear, it was all actually very good (praise the Lordt). Asked for a refill on water & quite a bit of it ended up on us instead of in the glass, which was fine. Had just come down from a hike, so that part was actually kinda refreshing. Don't have much of a reason to go back, but maybe this was just a fluke.

uNpJmvEVR20tJqFaeHc-_w.text: My girl and I stopped in here the other morning for breakfast.  We were promptly seated and our drinks delivered.   I don't like to be kept waiting to place my order when I'm hungry. So after waiting what I felt was an inordinate amount of time I decided to leave and eat elsewhere.  My girl decided to stay and eat her breakfast. She said the food was good, so we'll maybe try it another time and see if I can get an order placed.

OkM11ywyJj3-iuUWSvXjLQ.text: You would be better off going to IHOP than coming here. I wanted to give them a chance because their food looks so good on their Instagram page, but I later found out it was False advertisement. I also should have paid attention to the low yelp rating. I got the most basic breakfast: a gluten-free pancake, bacon and eggs. It tasted terrible!!! The pankake tasted like chalk. If you cannot make it right, do not sell it!! The eggs seemed like they were some processed mess and not real eggs. Oh, and the place is overpriced too. Dont waste your time and money!!

nzuUaI1oxtMLoBmb_-3ZjA.text: Not only is the food fantastic, but the staff is consistently friendly and helpful. I feel great every time I eat there; always met with a smile. Lovely place.

7wlXWertHpZM_V8dLXCyhA.text: You'll be fine as long as you avoid their potatoes.  They're undercooked and flavorless. I had eggs over medium with an English muffin and some bacon. Totally delicious. The coffee wasn't bad. Better than at Babystacks, which isn't saying a lot.    I didn't have pancakes, but they looked amazing. Lots of options for toppings, and each costs about $1.  Great service.

UdaCeXrOQd2cL9N9aRnFQg.text: Hands down, this is the best breakfast spot I've ever been to. Very few places where I'd admit that they cook better than I do, and this is one of those places. Enjoy!

lE0xxQlxoaL_-IREwx6WLg.text: Great service. Great atmosphere. Food looks very sexy. The presentation is great. It is unfortunate that the food does not taste as good as it looks. Very bland. Hot chocolate was watered down. I will not return.

t7m6561BXIV4Cf9jXMXGaw.text: Only reason a 3 Star is bc the first time I visited here I got the slow roasted homemade corned beef hash and it was alright a bit chunky more skillet like but the second time I came the same thing I ordered came out of a can. Was like Libby's corned beef hash was not even close to what I received a week before. That being said I like the canned kind better than their homemade so I wasn't angry. The waitress I had I could tell was New she brought me wheat toast instead the white I ordered them she brought two orders white toast instead of the one I had asked for. She for got my sausage patty I ordered then tried to tell me I wanted bacon other than that I could see the manager this dark skinned guy was trying hard to make everything and everyone run smoothly. I think it's a good business and place and people just got the busy chaotic newbie day lol

VdChNiSOhBXn8yVbKQwe8g.text: Service: I was greeted, told to select my seat, and given a menu immediately. The server came around several times to check on me. I also didn't have wait for the check.  Food: I ordered OJ, Churro style French toast, bacon and eggs.  The French Toast was overwhelmingly sweet but also mushy so that was a fail. A ordered 2 slices but could only power through 1. The eggs and bacon were cooked to my requested specifications so that was nice. The OJ must have been freshly squeezed based in the amount pulp and mild sweetness.  I wouldn't object to returning for regular French toast in a social setting.

KhF6qmZwnlPYbauHE08P-g.text: I'm more of a person who will go back to a establishment if the service is good even if the food is just all right just to give it another shot but this place is like the total opposite, food is great but service is blah.  I came in with my husband and we were told there is a 20 minute wait but there were plenty of empty tables so we told the hostess no thanks.  As we were walking out another gentleman called us back and said it will only be about 5 minutes so we decided to wait.  (possibility of a new hostess so we let it slide)  When we were seated we noticed the interior was pretty cool and the prices on the menu was reasonable so our mood was improving.  Our server was the reason it went down.  I didn't catch his name but it was a younger male and when we tried to call him over he literally gave us his hand and told us to wait while he was just standing by the counter... At this point my husband was really annoyed.  Luckily, our food came out and the pancakes were super fluffy but GINORMOUS so when I ordered a short stack (2 pancakes) I could only finish half.  There was another possibly hispanic female who did make sure our water was always full and we mentioned we wanted her as our waitress rather than our waiter but no matter, we probably won't come back.  I can get better service at egg yolks and they are way more busier than this place.

SyHTElJyOU60gtoBgwe5kw.text: I don't remember the last time I've given 5 stars if ever. This spot is definitely worth it. Any place that serves food good enough to continue to eat after you know that you're stuffed is alright with me.   It was nice and cool on the inside. There wasn't a long wait at all. The server was nice. Did I mention how good the food was?    My friend and I both had omelettes and french toast. We ordered different omelettes and different french toast and as always we try each others. Check them out and you wont be disappointed.

rEDfb7U4sa94U6D7-knarQ.text: I have been here a couple of times before. Once when it opened a few years back and again quite recently. The breakfast here are quite good and filling. They have your typical American style breakfast along with some ramped-up pancakes.  This time around I ordered the breakfast sandwich because I'm a sucker for a good breakfast sandwich. You can build it the way you want so I ordered egg whites and the turkey sausage which to me sounds kind of healthy. I will tell you this much it was a very good breakfast sandwich. It was very filling, hearty and tasty.   My daughter ordered the southern breakfast with biscuits and gravy. She enjoyed it very much and brought a lot of it home since it was a healthy serving.   Everything was great, the service was phenomenal and I definitely will be back!

Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Sandwich
Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House made cornedbeef hash and eggs

jplIk5yYeCy23d4hZokDXg.text: I was super excited to try this place out but I was a little disappointed with my visit. They are severely understaffed. When you walk in there is no direction on if you seat your self or wait for someone. I almost thought I had to go to the counter to order. The poor waiters were running around and barely had to time to clean tables. It took a while to get our order taken when we got in. I also had something in my drink and even though it was replaced that was no acknowledgement of my issue. We ordered pancakes and steak tips. The steak was great as well as the potatoes! But the pancakes were underwhelming. I could barely cut through them with my knife. I would consider back but it won't be my first choice for breakfast

photos.caption: Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fNG7D2XVjE4vqmQ4pNQJvA.text: Originally planned on just going to JuiceBoxLV, which is next door, but we were lured in seeing what other people sitting outside had ordered and were eating. Before even sitting down, we already knew that we wanted to order a skillet. We ended up with the hobo skillet, which came with biscuits and gravy. Both of us were craving pancakes too. We were contemplating double or a single and it's so good that we got the single because the pancake was freaking big. It was bigger than the size of my face!!  All the food was SOOO good! I would definitely return. The waiters were all super kind and helpful and cracked jokes with us. They have a good amount of seats inside but also a few outside. I'd say the only down side of sitting outside was there were so many birds and they're not scared to come close to your table. This place reminds me of a old diner that just got a make over. Don't expect to be blown away by the quality of the food, but I think it's up to par!

Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy
Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hobo skillet

C32Jvm3SosS-juikgcDxNA.text: Just left from here and the food was delicious. I have it 4 stars because we had to wait for someone to actually came and take our order. Staff was very friendly got our food in a timely matter. Will definitely visit again if I come back to Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuit &amp; gravy, scrambled eggs, and bacon
Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;The Hobo&#34; come with breakfast hash, eggs, cheese, onions, sausage.
Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original 3 stack French toast

8DfHVPUCQ3YupBxB-wfy8A.text: Well. Totally disappointed from the time we were seated. Waited 10 mins for waiter to ask what we were drinking. Coffee and water for the both us. Received in no time flat. But....we waited for another 5 mins and had to ask someone for table settings. Water was from the tap and received better attention from the bus person. Ordered our meals and again waited for approx 20 mins for it to arrive cold. Or should I say lukewarm at best. I really do not like to write a bad review and I am usually pretty good about checking reviews before trying a new place.  I didn't do that this time and we paid for it. Most reviews were 3 stars and below. I give it 1 star because the bus person was good to us. She ordered buttermilk pancakes with chocolate chips inside. Chips came on the side and good thing because the chips were two different colors. Doesn't that mean they mixed the new with the old? I'll never know. The one thing they were very good at was making sure I got the bill and took my payment right away. When the waiter asked how everything was I was about to say there was a problem he said that's great and walked away. WTF! I will not be recommending this eatery. But I will tell folks to steer clear. You want a great meal and service? Three words. BLACK BEAR DINER!

photos.caption: Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two flavors? Or?

GqcMK0QIR8J0qdM0a_GI8Q.text: Venue-5 stars Service-5 stars Food and presentation- 1 star  I was really disappointed with my meal. I ordered Californian egg Benedict. The presentation was bad. The plate in which they served it in had a black stains which made the plate look dirty. My potatoes were undercooked and they were so bland no seasoning at all. I took a bit out of one that I had to spit it out because it was hard and undercooked. The amount of hollandaise sauce on my plate was way too muchThey added way too much that by the time I got to my other side of the Benedict the bread was super soggy. Nobody wants to eat a soggy bread. Overall I would come back only to try their pancakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2aUxSEj7DQYlgcRyOw7u2w.text: This is one of my must have spots when I make a trip back home and everytime it's gets better ! The service is spot on , the food just gets better and the atmosphere makes my heart happy!   Let's start with the pancakes!! My girlfriend and I met for breakfast last week and ordered enough food to make the wonderful server, Andrew, ask if we had more people joining us!!  We ordered 3 single stack pancakes, PB, lemon/blueberry and LIPS, side of French toast, side of bacon and an omelette with a side of toast!! We laughed and ate the whole time!   Our service was 5 stars + and the manager , Baja, even came by with a special waffle treat at the end !! Like we needed more food!! Hahaha!!  The service was outstanding and the food was delish! I always love the food here and if you have to wait, it's so worth it even on a cold windy day!!   Well done !! Can't wait to come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Party of 2!!! Red velvet, lemon blueberry, PB pancakes, French toast and omelet with a side of bacon!
Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef special!! PB waffle, banana and Nutella!

tEtgMyr1VE7-svowASDaaA.text: So lets keep it 100 this place has good food. But its not all about the food. Its about the experience. This place needs to clean up for real! Dust on the dam lights toilet paper on the dam floor is unacceptable. Wtf is this tooth brush thing?  The wall outlet plate needs to be replaced and employee should not be drinking ocean spray cranberry juice out the fridge like it is there house. The silverware needs to be upgraded! I expect this kind of ratchetness on the NorthEast side of town not the southwest. The service was okay can be better I recommend fixing some things to get up to 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Random tooth brush holder

YDDHZBZLtsH2Y7W7H2koNg.text: No real butter for your toast, not even in the kitchen (I asked). How can you have a breakfast place without butter? Canned whip cream on the pancakes. Egg whites were slimey and raw on my "over hard" eggs. Hubbys bacon was soft and weird. Only good thing on our plates was the home fries! Really disappointed all around. I gave them an extra star because the waiter was very helpful and their bathroom toilet paper was better quality than I buy for home!

oWikpD71QYLjFult0t6iVA.text: How bad did I want pancakes? I got a taxi from our hotel... spent $40 there and back and it was so worth it. Not to mention I didn't know they had options of turning your French toast into churro French toast.  I couldn't even finish the pancakes because the portions were HUGE but if I ever come back to vegas I know where I'm going for breakfast!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yes that&#39;s churro French toast

-NEuEZCn-l1CGq7SIUrRZg.text: I should have listened to Yelp reviewers - I though OK avg 3 rating maybe hit and miss and today it will be good. For a place called Stacks and Yolks - unfortunately the stack was burned on both orders and the yolks were 180-degrees opposite of what was requested.   Ordered 2 Short Stacks - and both came out looking and tasting burned so even if the portion is big it's a big portion of burned-ness.  The eggs were ordered over easy - no joke, came out over hard. We sent it back and the guy comes back with the same plate of eggs and says the cook says these eggs are over easy. Are you kidding me? First you are rebuking the customer's claim and secondly, when is an over easy with a yolk that is scrambled and hard and the whites are browned?!!!?  Third time - guy comes back and finally it is over easy but yikes, sat in a bunch of grease. Too disappointed to even take pictures of all this.  So, all in all. I won't be back. I walk out thinking - should have seen the signs from my fellow Yelpers.

TIpefmFke1VQYKheinH63A.text: Red Velvet Pancake was bomb, if you check in on social media you get it for free. The corn beef and hash was NOT good, for $14.99 I was expecting a bit more, the picture I took was with two bites gone and not much corn beef in it. That was a bit disappointing, other than that it was good. Service was a bit slow, missed our water and had lipstick on the glass.   But I highly recommend it for the pancakes alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy with sausage and egg
Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Pancake was bomb, if you check in on social media you get it for free.

4gETu35AMSyNr2Utyz8xKg.text: Came in last minute, around 2:30 today. Jose the only server on the floor was friendly and welcoming. I felt bad that they were closing in 30 minutes but my daughter really wanted pancakes.  We ordered the kids pancake face, a customized omelette and a skillet. All where a great portion size.  The kids pancake face was super cute and made my daughter happy!  The omelette was really good and I had a side of hash browns which were cooked to perfection.  My boyfriend said his skillet was good as well!  All this was whipped up in a matter of minutes and I had no complaints what so ever.  Food is good and service is great.   And the best part of the experience was that our server wasn't bothered by us. He did his check backs promptly and not once was I felt rushed to leave. Thank you Jose for giving me the opportunity to make my daughter with her pancake craving!   We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Stacks & Yolks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HIa46GNVKNqgwLcNpzXhLA.text: Not impressed, at all. Scrambled eggs were way over cooked and slightly brown. The toast was over buttered, after it was cold so the butter did not melt. The corned beef hash was the smallest amount and flattened down to made it look like there was more. Neither the "home fries" or has browns have an seasoning, onion, peppers, nothing.  Then when I received the bill the had charged me for a plate that was $4.00 more than what I ordered. The only saving grace at this place is the staff is actually friendly.

dBqxGgsa3AKz9zv8kHc4Yw.text: Friendly staff and gigantic portions. Pretty good prices for Vegas.  I had the the "Mexican Huevos". Unlike a huevos rancheros, it was served over a flour tortilla, with no sauce to speak of-- a bit bland. While it would have been better with well-oiled corn tortillas and a spicy sauce, the portion was generous and the beef decent quality.  On a first visit, staff seemed overwhelmed by a modest crowd at 11am, but were still friendly. Portions are substantial, and several of the diners seemed to be regulars. There's a bunch of flavored batters on the menu, and this might be your spot if pancakes are your thing.
